result.execSummary:
The defendant Eleazar Diaz-Sanchez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Eleazar Diaz-Sanchez is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Eleazar Diaz-Sanchez was found guilty of Possess w/Intent-Amphetamine (>50g) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, On or Near a School], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(e)4.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

superMiscConds.notes: Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.  May not associate with gangs/gang members or gang affiliations or disruptive groups.   May not have contact with Alexsander Diaz-Sanchez, Alex Luna-Diaz or Ruben Luna-Diaz, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.   May not possess any weapons, including firearms.  Not to enter or be in the United States without proper documentations of lawful presence.  Report to Probation/Parole Agent within 72 hours of entry, legal or illegal; report any changes to immigration statuswithin 72 hours;  report to Probation/Parole Agent within 24 hours of release from ICE Custody within the United States.  No association with any   individuals who use or traffic in controled substances.

PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Tracey Braun appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Denise Hertz-McGrath.  Clerk: PT
Sentencing arguments made.    Defendant is sentenced to 8 years in the WSP forthwith; 4 years Initial Confinement followed by 4 years of Extended Supervision.  Credit for 267 days.  DE is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Substance Abuse Program.  No contact with co-defendants.  Appeal Rights, Firearm Warning & Voting Acknowledgement given.

Attorney Tracey Braun appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Denise Hertz-McGrath.  Interpreter Diaz in court.  Clerk: PT
Interpreter Diaz is sworn in and case is resolved.  Count 2 DE pleads Guilty; found guilty by the court.  Counts 1 & 3 - Dismissed by the State.  PSI ordered.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 6, 2016 at 02:15 pm.
Per Atty Hertz-McGrath's office DE will be entering a plea and motion hearing is no longer needed so motion has been chaned to a plea date.

Attorney Michael Graveley appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Denise Hertz-McGrath. Interpreter Alberto Aguilar Clerk: PT
Interpreter Agguilar is sworn in.  Argument heard by Atty Hertz-McGrath, Atty Rose (co-Deft) and Atty Richards regarding their issues with the affidavit that was provided to them prior to court.  ADA Graveley is sworn in on the affidavit.  Upon hearing arguments court grants motion to unseal search warrants received 12/16/16 & 1/8/16 so copy can be provided to the attorneys.  Cases are not resolved.  Jury status hearing scheduled for August 18, 2016 at 01:00 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for August 22, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Tracey Braun appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Denise Hertz-McGrath.  Interpreter Alberto Aguilar present in court.  Clerk: PT
Interpreter Aguilar is sworn in.  Atty Braun objects to defenses motion to unseal the search warrant filed by DE counsel in 15CF1191 and 15CF1192, but has no objection to the motion for an in camera inspection filed by DE counsel in 15CF1194.  Arguments heard by defense counsel.  Court will conduct an in-camera inspection and Atty Braun shall file an affidavit from Det. Alfredson and will brief her response by 3/24/16.  Defense counsel will file their responses by 4/8/16.   Court will render a decision at the next hearing on 4/15/16.
